p: The predominant medicinal plant part (leaves), botanical form (herbs), preparation (decoction), and administration (oral intake) method used were also observed in earlier medicinal plant studies [ 51â€“ 54]. The widespread medicinal use of leaves is probably due to the fact that they are easily and conveniently harvested [ 55] but also because they are the site par excellence of biosynthesis and storage of secondary metabolites, responsible for biological plant properties [ 56, 57].
